predictions.text: At the meeting concluding 2025-11-05, the FOMC will leave the federal funds target range unchanged at 5.25%–5.50%.
predictions.verification_criteria: Confirm via the FOMC statement on federalreserve.gov that the target range remains 5.25%–5.50% as of 2025-11-05.
monitoring_signals: Payrolls, unemployment rate, and average hourly earnings
Financial conditions indexes and credit spreads
predictions.rationale: Inflation progress is uneven but improving; Fed likely to hold while assessing data.

predictions.text: U.S. CPI Core (MoM, SA) for October 2025 will print between 0.20% and 0.30% in the BLS release due by 2025-11-15.
predictions.verification_criteria: Verify the 1-month percent change for CPI-U less food and energy (seasonally adjusted) in the BLS CPI news release tables.
monitoring_signals: Health insurance and medical services CPI components
Retail gasoline prices and core goods import prices
predictions.rationale: Shelter disinflation continues; goods remain soft; services steady near 0.2–0.3%.

predictions.text: U.S. Retail Sales Control Group (MoM, SA) for September 2025 will print between -0.2% and +0.3% in the Census release due by 2025-10-16.
predictions.verification_criteria: Use the Census Advance Monthly Retail and Food Services report; control group = retail sales excluding motor vehicles & parts, gasoline, building materials, and food services.
monitoring_signals: Gasoline prices and auto sales mix
Consumer confidence and labor market indicators
predictions.rationale: Real spending looks steady to soft; fuel drag and mixed discretionary outlays.

predictions.text: Euro area Composite PMI (final) for October 2025 will print between 49.5 and 51.5 in the HCOB/S&P Global release due by 2025-11-06.
predictions.verification_criteria: Check the headline HCOB Eurozone Composite PMI (final) index level in the S&P Global news release.
monitoring_signals: Flash PMI readings for Germany and France
Export orders and new business components
Energy prices and credit conditions surveys
predictions.rationale: Services resilience balances weak manufacturing; composite near 50 with limited improvement.

predictions.text: U.S. Housing Starts (SAAR) for September 2025 will print between 1.33 million and 1.45 million in the Census/HUD release due by 2025-10-17.
predictions.verification_criteria: Verify total housing starts (seasonally adjusted annual rate) in the New Residential Construction release tables on census.gov.
monitoring_signals: Lumber prices and construction labor availability
predictions.rationale: High mortgage rates cap starts; permits leveling suggests range-bound prints.

predictions.text: China Total Social Financing (flow) for September 2025 will print between CNY 3.0 trillion and CNY 4.6 trillion in the PBOC release by 2025-10-15.
predictions.verification_criteria: Confirm monthly TSF flow in the PBOC Aggregate Financing to the Real Economy (AFRE) statistical release.
monitoring_signals: New RMB loans and shadow credit proxies
PBOC OMO/MLF operations and reserve measures
Property sales and developer financing conditions
predictions.rationale: Seasonal September pickup from bond issuance and policy guidance boosts TSF.

predictions.text: Seasonally adjusted U.S. initial jobless claims 4-week moving average will reach at or above 225,000 in at least one weekly Department of Labor report published by 2025-11-15.
predictions.verification_criteria: Check the 4-week moving average in any weekly Unemployment Insurance Weekly Claims News Release from DOL through 2025-11-15.
predictions.rationale: Labor market is cooling gradually; averages drift higher with softer hiring.

predictions.text: The Cboe Volatility Index (VIX) will close at or below 14.00 on at least one trading day by 2025-11-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Use Cboe’s official VIX historical end-of-day data to confirm any daily close ≤ 14.00 through 2025-11-30.
monitoring_signals: Macro event risk calendar and earnings season
Credit spreads and cross-asset volatility indices
predictions.rationale: Absent shocks, post-earnings and holiday seasonality often compress implied vol.

predictions.text: USD/CNH (CNH=X) will trade at or below 7.20 on at least one UTC trading day by 2025-11-30.
predictions.verification_criteria: Confirm via Yahoo Finance (CNH=X) or Bloomberg intraday/daily data that the low on any UTC day is ≤ 7.20 by the deadline.
monitoring_signals: PBOC fixing bias vs. model-implied fix
U.S.–China rate differentials and UST yield moves
predictions.rationale: Potential softer USD on lower yields plus RMB support measures could lift CNH.

predictions.text: From 2025-10-13 close to 2025-11-30 close, Financials (XLF) will outperform Technology (XLK) by at least 2.5 percentage points based on adjusted close percentage change.
predictions.verification_criteria: Compute % change in adjusted close (Yahoo Finance: XLF, XLK) from 2025-10-13 close to 2025-11-30 close; require (XLF% − XLK%) ≥ 2.5pp.
monitoring_signals: Yield curve steepening and 10Y Treasury moves
Bank earnings guidance and NIM commentary
Tech earnings revisions and semiconductor cycle
Credit conditions and loan growth data
predictions.rationale: Rotation toward cyclicals on stabilizing rates and steeper curve pressures megacap tech.

predictions.text: NYMEX WTI crude oil front-month futures (CL) will settle at or below $74.00 per barrel on at least one trading day by 2025-11-30.
predictions.verification_criteria: Use CME/NYMEX official settlements for the front-month CL contract to confirm any daily settlement ≤ $74.00 by the deadline.
monitoring_signals: EIA U.S. crude inventories and builds at Cushing
predictions.rationale: Macro growth worries and inventory builds can pressure crude despite OPEC+.

predictions.text: ICE Endex Dutch TTF front-month natural gas will settle at or below €33/MWh on at least one trading day by 2025-11-30.
predictions.verification_criteria: Confirm via ICE Endex official market data that the TTF front-month daily settlement is ≤ €33/MWh on any day through 2025-11-30.
predictions.rationale: High storage and mild weather risk favor lower TTF barring supply shocks.
